Title: Brutally Honest Oscar Ballot No. 1: â€˜Conclaveâ€™ for Best Picture, â€˜Emilia PÃ©rezâ€™ Star Lost His Vote with Tweets
Paragraphs: ['', '', 'This member of the Academy\'s short films branch also says that \'No Other Land\' deserved a best picture nom and got his vote for best doc feature: "It moved me so much. I wasnâ€™t really aware of what was going on over there [in the West Bank], and it\'s just so objectively awful."', 'BY ANONYMOUS, AS TOLD TO SCOTT FEINBERG', 'This â€œBrutally Honest Oscar Ballot,â€ the first in a series that THR will run ahead of Oscar night, reflects the votes â€” and candid rationales for them â€” of a male member of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciencesâ€™ 202-person short films branch, as communicated to THR in return for anonymity. THR does not necessarily endorse these views or suggest that they are representative of anything other than this voterâ€™s perspective.', 'Best picture', 'I liked Emilia PÃ©rez when I watched it but, even before all the shit that happened [involving lead actress Karla SofÃ­a GascÃ³n], it wasnâ€™t in my top 10. Iâ€™d have preferred to see its spot go to Sing Sing, which was underappreciated; or Juror #2, which I really liked; or The Wild Robot or No Other Land, but you know how most of the Academy treats animated and documentary films â€” no respect. I do like musicals, and Wicked was tight. Iâ€™m Still Here was great, and, as weâ€™ll come to, itâ€™s my pick for international feature. I really liked the performances in A Complete Unknown â€” the fact that Timmy [Chalamet] and Monica [Barbaro] were both really singing and playing the guitar was incredible. Anora was great â€” the story and the performances were really fun, Sean [Baker] directed the shit out of it â€” but the others did more for me. The Substance was what I love about cinema at its best. Itâ€™s so bold â€” the story, the sound design, the makeup. They gave the audience an experience. And itâ€™s so rare for the Academy to recognize a horror film, but the fact that this one is kind of about what itâ€™s like to be a woman in Hollywood probably helped more people to connect with it. I loved the first Dune. Dune: Part Two had some weaker story elements â€” he [Denis Villeneuve] cares so much more about visuals than storytelling, and you can notice that in this one more than the first â€” and I didnâ€™t think Zendaya was that great in it. But the cinematic spectacle of it was so monumental that I still was blown away. Nickel Boys is so audacious â€” Iâ€™d read the book, and let me tell you, that is not an easy one to adapt, but the way that RaMell Ross did it, with the first-person perspective, was exactly right. But for me, the final two films were incredibly hard to decide between. Going in to The Brutalist, Iâ€™d never heard of Brady Corbet and was dreading the [three-and-a-half-hour] runtime, but the way people who had seen it at the festivals were talking about it convinced me to go to a screening really early in the season, and by the end I really appreciated why he did it the way he did it. Itâ€™s just an incredible film â€” beautifully shot, amazing performances, and such a powerful story. But Conclave was so interesting and exciting in a completely different way â€” and fun, with a little mystery involved. I thought the ending was great â€” it wasnâ€™t trying to make a point, it was just a perfect reveal. Edward Berger is an incredible director.', '', 'VOTE: (1) Conclave, (2) The Brutalist, (3) Nickel Boys, (4) Dune: Part Two, (5) The Substance, (6) Anora, (7) A Complete Unknown, (8) Iâ€™m Still Here, (9) Wicked, (10) Emilia PÃ©rez', '', 'Best director                                                                                           ', 'I judge this category like one judges an Olympic sport: the degree of difficulty, plus the execution â€” did you stick the landing? I think this category needs to be expanded to at least eight. Edward Berger, RaMell Ross and Denis Villeneuve shouldâ€™ve been nominated. How many other directors couldâ€™ve done what they did? And why is [A Complete Unknownâ€™s] James Mangold in here but they arenâ€™t? Heâ€™s a really good director â€” he told the story well â€” but there was nothing special about the way he directed that film. You want to tell me that directing Timmy Chalamet in New York was harder than directing an epic in the desert? Come on. I was torn between Brady and [The Substanceâ€™s] Coralie Fargeat, and I ended up going with Coralie. If she wasnâ€™t there, Iâ€™d have picked Brady, because the fact that he made his movie look that good with only $10 million is unbelievable. But I just thought about historical absence [only three women have ever won this categoryâ€™s Oscar] and high degree of execution â€” she nailed it with that film.', '', 'VOTE: Coralie Fargeat, The Substance', 'Best actor', 'I had a hard time with this one. Timmy was probably the easiest one for me to let go. Ralph [Fiennes of Conclave], [The Brutalistâ€™s Adrien] Brody and Colmanâ€™s [Domingo of Sing Sing] performances were just so good. I got to hear a lot from the Sing Sing guys, and really liked them, and I think that what Colman did for that movie, on and off screen, was just remarkable.', 'VOTE: Colman Domingo, Sing Sing', 'Best actress', 'I was very strongly considering voting for Karla, but when her tweets started coming out I was flabbergasted â€” I was like, â€œI canâ€™t believe this person said these things.â€ And it kept getting worse every day. It quickly became obvious, â€œIâ€™m not voting for this person. No way.â€ After that, it was between Mikey [Madison of Anora] and Demi [Moore of The Substance]. Both of them are at the heart of their films, and I loved both of their films. Iâ€™m not opposed to voting for new, younger people, when they are amazing. But Demi has been around for a long time, and she absolutely crushed it.', 'VOTE: Demi Moore, The Substance', 'Best supporting actor', 'I thought it was insane that the one guy from Anora [Yura Borisov] got nominated over the other two [Mark Eydelshteyn and Karren Karagulian]. I seriously considered [The Apprenticeâ€™s] Jeremy Strong and [The Brutalistâ€™s] Guy Pearce, but at the end of the day I just loved Kieran [Culkin] in A Real Pain.', 'VOTE: Kieran Culkin, A Real Pain', '', 'Best supporting actress', 'I was never as high on Zoe [SaldaÃ±a of Emilia PÃ©rez] as everyone else was. I definitely considered [Conclaveâ€™s Isabella] Rossellini. But I was just so impressed with Monica in A Complete Unknown. The only other thing Iâ€™d ever seen her in was Top Gun [Maverick], and this was like another person.', 'VOTE: Monica Barbaro, A Complete Unknown', 'Best adapted screenplay', 'I was open to any of them except Emilia PÃ©rez. The more I thought about it, the more I was torn between Conclave, Nickel Boys and Sing Sing.', 'VOTE: Sing Sing', 'Best original screenplay', 'Anora and A Real Pain are really good scripts, but scripts donâ€™t get more original than The Substance.', 'VOTE: The Substance', 'Best animated feature', 'I was absolutely certain I was going to vote for Inside Out 2 â€” until I saw The Wild Robot. The Wild Robotâ€™s story, humor, emotion and score are just so strong.', 'VOTE: The Wild Robot', 'Best documentary feature', 'I wasnâ€™t blown away by Sugarcane. I was torn between Black Box Diaries and No Other Land. I ended up voting for No Other Land because it moved me so much. I wasnâ€™t really aware of what was going on over there [in the West Bank], and itâ€™s just so objectively awful.', 'VOTE: No Other Land', 'Best international feature', 'I probably wouldâ€™ve voted for Emilia PÃ©rez had all that not gone down. After that, it was between Iâ€™m Still Here and The Seed of the Sacred Fig, and I just liked Iâ€™m Still Here a little more.', '', 'VOTE: Iâ€™m Still Here, Brazil', 'Best cinematography', 'You could take so many stills from The Brutalist and frame them. But I went with Dune: Part Two because Brady was shooting miniatures, but what Denis and Greig [Fraser] did was on a whole different scale and looked absolutely beautiful.', 'VOTE: Dune: Part Two', 'Best costume design', 'It was between Wicked and Conclave for me. I went with Conclave because Iâ€™d heard Edward Berger talk about the way they selected the robes and changed certain colors, and it just looked really cool. That said, I wish Iâ€™d realized at the time that Paul Tazewell did Wicked, because Paul is a legend.', 'VOTE: Conclave', 'Best film editing', 'There are some really interesting sequences in Anora, like the home invasion in the middle, but I voted for The Brutalist. Some people are like, â€œA three-and-a-half-hour movie needs more editing,â€ but I regarded it as two movies split up by the intermission, and I felt that there wasnâ€™t really any fat on the bone.', 'VOTE: The Brutalist', 'Best makeup and hairstyling', 'It wasnâ€™t close for me: The Substance. The way the makeup and prosthetics progress as Demi is aging rapidly, up through the end scene, is just so good.', 'VOTE: The Substance', 'Best original score', 'I write to scores, so Iâ€™ve heard all of this yearâ€™s nominees many times, and all of them are really good. But [The Wild Robotâ€™s] Kris Bowers deserves it this year. He has deserved it for a number of years.', '', 'VOTE: The Wild Robot', 'Best original song', 'I donâ€™t think the song choices this year were that great. I was lukewarm on the Emilia PÃ©rez songs [â€œEl Malâ€ and â€œMi Caminoâ€] even before the Karla shit; after, I was like, â€œI donâ€™t really want to award this movie.â€ So for me it was between [â€œLike a Birdâ€ from] Sing Sing and Elton [John: Never Too Lateâ€™s â€œNever Too Lateâ€]. I voted for Sing Sing because, within the context of the film, I thought the song worked, and I wanted to show the film some love. The song from The Six Triple Eight [â€œThe Journeyâ€] didnâ€™t really do anything for me, but Iâ€™ve since learned that itâ€™s a Diane Warren song [the names of the songwriter(s) of the nominated songs do not appear on the ballot]; if I had known that, it probably wouldâ€™ve affected my vote, which is probably what theyâ€™re trying to avoid. [laughs]', 'VOTE: â€œLike a Birdâ€ from Sing Sing', 'Best production design', 'I went with Conclave. They essentially remade the Vatican, which is fucking crazy. If you didnâ€™t know any better, youâ€™d think that they were shooting there. They nailed it.', 'VOTE: Conclave', 'Best sound', 'Each nominee is so different, but I went with Dune: Part Two because I think that having to do the sound design for an epic like that is just much harder than it is for a musical [the other nominees are all largely music-centric].', 'VOTE: Dune: Part Two', 'Best visual effects', 'Dune: Part Two. It wasnâ€™t close.', '', 'VOTE: Dune: Part Two', 'Best animated short', 'Several of them were very good, but I voted for Yuck! because it was really adorable.', 'VOTE: Yuck!', 'Best documentary short', 'I loved Incident and I Am Ready, Warden. I picked Incident because itâ€™s told entirely with surveillance and body camera footage, and yet itâ€™s a complete narrative. Itâ€™s not telling you anything; itâ€™s showing you and letting you come to your own conclusion.', 'VOTE: Incident', 'Best live-action short', 'I liked a lot of them, but especially Iâ€™m Not a Robot and The Last Ranger. I went with The Last Ranger because it was really well shot, and I was trying to figure out how the fuck they did it.', 'VOTE: The Last Ranger', 'Sign up for THR news straight to your inbox every day', 'Sign up for THR news straight to your inbox every day', 'Subscribe for full access to The Hollywood Reporter', 'Send us a tip using our anonymous form.']

Title: Secret Oscar Voter 3: Ballot exposed with â€˜The Brutalist,â€™ Adrien Brody, Demi Moore
Paragraphs: ['Here in the final stages of the 2025 Oscar season, several Academy Awards voters have revealed their ballots to Gold Derby, telling us who they voted for â€” and why. We promised to keep their identities confidential and their comments unfiltered. Now that voting has concluded, we will share a few of the no-longer-secret ballots with you. Below are the selections of Voter 3. You can also read the summary of secret Oscar Voter 1 and Oscar Voter 2.', 'OK, The Brutalist technically is also not been spoken enough about, and I must say is a  very, very, very, very beautifully done film visually on many levels. I was definitely glad to see it get in there for several of the crafts categories because it was such a late release. I like Anora, and Wicked is at the very opposite end, but thereâ€™s something very special [about Wicked]. Itâ€™s kind of a modern-day Mary Poppins or The Sound of Music. People could be more transparent about how they think about films without being criticized and thrown to the wolvesâ€¦ actually say what they really think about film. Second place is Wicked. Third place is Anora.', '', '', 'You feel like they really pulled that off being able to tell a story that lengthy? Yeah, people talk about that, donâ€™t they?', 'Vulnerable and vulnerable just again! It encompasses what youâ€™re meant to be doing, you know.', 'Itâ€™s a perfect performance in a fantastic film. I donâ€™t know the person, and I have no vested interest. Iâ€™ve got no monkey in this circus. It took my breath away.', 'Sheâ€™s my first choice because I think itâ€™s a difficult role and very misunderstood. Itâ€™s unattractive, you know, itâ€™s ugly, and people donâ€™t like that, especially in Hollywood. Not her mind you but the way the character has to be performed.', 'Thatâ€™s a tour de force, an incredible performance of somebody whoâ€™s deserving and been around forever. Itâ€™s not a nice character, is it? But thatâ€™s the greatness of it.', 'Very hard choice here, but Iâ€™m going to say Conclave because I wanted to put a few films up for wins more than just one all of the time The other mature choice here would be Nickel Boys, but I would say Iâ€™m very torn.', '', '', 'I think Anora because it hit me on so many levels than the others. But I mean it could be Emilia PÃ©rez. I could sway very easily. I was steadfast on this and now Iâ€™m thinking, hang on with Anora. I think every great movie should get something.', 'SIGN UP for Gold Derbyâ€™s free newsletter with latest predictions', 'All I like on this ballot is Demi Moore and Conclave. The rest I could do without. Still, Iâ€™ve been thinking lately how we might be underestimating Corbet for Director after his DGA loss. He still won the Globe and Bafta.', 'â€œI think Anora because it hit me on so many levels than the others. But I mean it could be Emilia PÃ©rez.â€ EP is in Adapted, not Original Screenplay. Apparently this voter forgot that.', 'Then I guess we can be sure they voted for Anora once they realized it.', 'What branch is this person from? Make-up?', 'Why are you publishing only the BP, director, screenplay and acting categories, rather than the entire ballot, as Variety and Next Best Picture have done?', 'demi was mediocre at best, .. the makeup did the acting.', 'Your email address will not be published. Required fields are marked *', 'Comment *', 'Name *', 'Email *', 'Website', '', '', '', 'Did the BAFTAs change the Oscar race? Will Demi Moore rebound at the Screen Actors Guild Awards? Awards Magnet hosts Christopher Rosen and Joyce Eng discuss the BAFTAs and make their SAG predictions with Gold Derby editor-in-chief Debra Birnbaum. Click the photo above to watch the video.', 'Watch our chats with Demi Moore (The Substance) and many more 2025 Oscar nomineesâ€¦', '', 'Take a trip back to the Academy Awards ceremonies of the recent past with Gold Derbyâ€™s Oscars Playback series. Hosts Joyce Eng and Christopher Rosen recap every Oscar ceremony of the 1990s and 2000s. Joyce and Chris tackle the highs and lows of each show and see how the winners aged. Itâ€™s a wonderful night for Oscar, whenever you watch!', 'GOLD DERBY IS A PART OF PENSKE MEDIA CORPORATION. Â© 2025 GOLD DERBY MEDIA, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.\nDEADLINE MEDIA', '', '', '']

Title: Oscar voting has officially closed â€” so here are our burning questions
Paragraphs: ['', '', '', '', '', 'Pencils down, tabs closed. Oscar winner voting officially closed at 8 p.m. ET/5 p.m. PT, meaning the end of the most unpredictable awards season in recent memory is nearing the finish line. Before the 2025 Oscars ceremony reveals this yearâ€™s winners â€” and ahead of the several anonymous Oscar voters who will be discussing their preferences with us between now and March 2 â€” here are the three biggest burning questions about the race.', 'After Anora breakout Mikey Madison won at the BAFTA Awards on Sunday against The Substance star Demi Moore, it confirmed the long-held speculation that the Oscars Best Actress race had not yet been decided. In some ways, regardless of whether she wins at the Screen Actors Guild Awards on Sunday, it is arguably Madison who now holds the edge against the veteran actress. Madison is guaranteed at least a split of the industry precursors and leads the Best Picture frontrunner. But before Team Anora and Madisonâ€™s online stans start popping champagne in anticipation of her potential Best Actress win, consider this: Neither Madison nor Moore has competed against the exact Oscar Best Actress field yet this season. Thatâ€™s because Iâ€™m Still Here star Fernanda Torres, the Golden Globe Award winner for Best Drama Actress, was snubbed by both the BAFTA Awards and SAG Awards (and didnâ€™t land a Critics Choice Award nomination either). On the one hand, Torresâ€™s failure to secure bids from those influential industry groups might give her the appearance of an also-ran. But donâ€™t judge a book by its cover: the passion for Torres is hard to ignore â€” so much so that itâ€™s possible her support within the Academy actually pushed Iâ€™m Still Here into the Best Picture field, where it was a long shot to receive a nomination. Torres is also the â€œapple in the bag of oranges,â€ if youâ€™ll excuse the idiom. Iâ€™m Still Here is a biographical film about the real-life activist Eunice Paiva, and the drama has anecdotally left several audiences overcome with emotion. The other four nominees for Best Actress, including Madison and Moore? Theyâ€™re in comedies with dramatic elements, musicals with dramatic elements, or a body-horror satire with dramatic elements. That doesnâ€™t mean Torres should be considered the frontrunner here or that sheâ€™ll eventually emerge victoriously to shock the world (but not her Brazilian fan base, which has given her rabid support online for months). However, sheâ€™s probably a lot closer to pulling off the unlikely win than many want to think about.', 'More from GoldDerby', "'Zero Day' reviews: Critics call Robert De Niro thriller 'an astonishing amount of fun' - and also 'deadly dull'", "'Wicked' and TimothÃ©e Chalamet are predicted to win at the 2025 SAG Awards: Get all the official odds", "'Sing Sing,' 'Nickel Boys' win big at the 2025 African American Film Critics Awards", 'Sean Baker may leave the Oscars on March 2 with his name placed alongside Walt Disney in the Academy Awards record books. With four nominations â€” as a producer, director, editor, and writer â€” Baker could tie Disney with four Oscar wins in a single night (and become the first person to win four Oscars for a single project, unlike Disney). It feels like Baker will win two or three of those four nominations: Best Picture and Best Director. (Even though Baker lost at the BAFTAs, itâ€™s hard to bet against a precursor like the Directors Guild Awards, which has matched the Oscars in 18 of the last 20 years and was won this year by the Anora filmmaker.) He could also win Best Original Screenplay, although perhaps Jesse Eisenberg will surprise for A Real Pain and break a 20-year streak at the Oscars. Only the editing race seems out of play: not only did Baker lose in that category at the BAFTA Awards to presumed favorite Conclave, heâ€™d also be only the second director in 35 years to win an Oscar for editing his own movie (Alfonso CuarÃ³n was a co-editor when he won for Gravity).', 'Just after the Oscar nominations and before Karla SofÃ­a GascÃ³n exploded the Emilia PÃ©rez Best Picture campaign, it felt like six movies were in legitimate competition for the top Oscar. Or maybe that was a mirage, especially with Wicked becoming a tech player and A Complete Unknown continually being blanked by the industry. (The Bob Dylan biopic has not won a major award this season.) Heading into Sundayâ€™s SAG Awards, Anora remains the frontrunner â€” and if any movie other than Conclave were to win Best Ensemble from the Actors Guild, it would stay the overwhelming best bet. And if Conclave were to win? Well, Anora is still the frontrunner, but maybe the race is slightly closer.', 'Best of GoldDerby', 'When are the Oscars? 2025 Academy Awards date, time, nominees', 'Jane Fonda movies: 15 greatest films ranked worst to best', "'Conclave' takes Best Picture at 2025 BAFTA Awards, thwarting 'The Brutalist' and 'Anora'", "Sign up for Gold Derby's Newsletter. For the latest news, follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.", 'Click here to read the full article.']

Title: Secret Oscar Voter 6: Ballot exposed with â€˜The Brutalist,â€™ Fernanda Torres, Adrien Brody
Paragraphs:
['Here in the final stages of the 2025 Oscar season, several Academy Awards voters have revealed their ballots to Gold Derby, telling us who they voted for â€“ and why. We promised to keep their identities confidential and their comments unfiltered. Now that voting has concluded, we will share a few of no-longer-secret ballots with you. Below are the selections of Voter 6. You can also read the summary of secret Oscar Voter 1, Oscar Voter 2, Oscar Voter 3, Oscar Voter 4, and Oscar Voter 5.', 'BEST PICTURE: The Brutalist', 'No other film this year has made a stronger case for cinema being a legitimate and pure form of art than The Brutalist. It is a work of art, plain and simple. Beyond its themes about immigration and the American dream, itâ€™s just as much a dissection of the human condition. The story, direction, and performances do justice to every single theme the film tackles, from power struggles to the design process. Itâ€™s also the most aesthetically pleasing film among the nominees; the marble sequence brought me to tears. Iâ€™m Still Here is a close second, I thought it was absolutely magnificent and it touched me on a very personal level. In third, Nickel Boys. ', '', '', 'BEST DIRECTOR: Brady Corbet (The Brutalist)', 'What Corbet accomplished with The Brutalist is nothing short of mindblowing. With limited resources, he created what felt like a mega-production. Epic in scale, complex, and yet incredibly intimate at the same time. Every element of the production â€” from the cinematography to the production design â€” contributes to create a cohesive whole, and thatâ€™s down to Brady Corbetâ€™s direction. ', 'BEST ACTRESS: Fernanda Torres (Iâ€™m Still Here)', 'Torres delivers such a pure performance, without the need of any prosthetics or special effects (something that is becoming rarer to find these days). The way she can express so much with a performance that is so internal is truly masterful. She moved me deeply. ', 'BEST ACTOR: Adrien Brody (The Brutalist)', 'Brody guides us through the epic journey that is The Brutalist. Heâ€™s able to convey LÃ¡szlÃ³â€™s dreams, desires and frustrations in the subtlest of ways. I was inspired by the way his character sees art everywhere, in everyday objects, in life. Brody sells it throughout the entire 3 1/2-hour runtime. I wish I could vote for more than one actor, though. TimothÃ©e Chalametâ€™s performance was also very impressive. ', '', '', 'BEST SUPPORTING ACTRESS: Felicity Jones (The Brutalist)', 'This was probably the hardest category to vote for. Isabella Rossellini is amazing in Conclave, but severely underutilized. Zoe SaldaÃ±a saves Emilia PÃ©rez for me, but sheâ€™s the protagonist of the film; I wouldnâ€™t feel comfortable voting for her as a supporting actress. Which leaves Felicity Jones, who is able to carry out a complete and fully-realized character arc despite only being in only half of the picture. I thought she was phenomenal. ', 'BEST SUPPORTING ACTOR: Yura Borisov (Anora)', 'Borisovâ€™s performance perfectly complements the vertiginous pace of Anora. He was the costar of that final act, which was my favorite part of the movie. He manages to deliver a comedic performance with a lot of heart. ', 'BEST ADAPTED SCREENPLAY: Nickel Boys', 'I struggled with this category. Conclave has a strong screenplay, one that elevates the source material, but that final act is the weakest part of the film, and thatâ€™s down to the writing. I went with Nickel Boys, a really tough book to adapt but it worked for me on every level. I wish RaMell Ross had been nominated for Best Director, but Iâ€™ll gladly give him my vote in this category instead.', 'BEST ORIGINAL SCREENPLAY: Anora', 'I was really close to voting for The Brutalist in this category as well. I thought the dialogues were more profound and thought-provoking than Anoraâ€™s, but Anora is a different type of movie. Its structure is really creative, as is the way it tackles its themes. Yes, the dialogues may be a bit superficial, but they work completely within the context of the story Sean Baker is telling. ', '', '', 'SIGN UP for Gold Derbyâ€™s free newsletter with latest predictions', 'Are these anonymous voters actually all north-americans? â€˜Cause Fernanda Torres is doing quite well among them, and if we go to the international context, I meanâ€¦', 'The fact that a Brazilian actress delivered a STUNNING performance, far better than the others, is so hard to admit? You obviously didnâ€™t watch Iâ€™m still here. You should, specially if you are an American: our past is your future. Donâ€™t be prejudiced.', 'Of course they are North Americans. Theyâ€™re people from North America that actually know what good cinema is!!!', 'Why â€œof courseâ€? This is an international pool of voters.', 'ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£', 'Are you confusing North America with America?', 'Thatâ€™s probably an international voter with the Brutalist and Fernanda Torres love.', 'Americans will vote for American movies only and Anora is the most American you can go this year. Weâ€™re finally America First!', 'You are sick, you deserve Trump as president, in fact, you are the perfect reflection of him. Disgusting.', 'do you mean North-Americans wouldnâ€™t be able to pick up the best performer independently of their nationality ? Thatâ€™s a concern .', 'Well, they elected Trump.', 'do you mean North-Americans are not able to spot and vote for the best performance ? I mean : a foreign actor that delivers the best performance would be ignored by Americans, just because he/she is not American?', 'Quite well for what? Sheâ€™s not even giving the Penelope Cruz vibe. So save the crap. Plus, I highly doubt European voters would vote for her.', 'What iâ€™m trying to say is that the momentum of Iâ€™m Still Here especifically is different to any other picture weâ€™ve seen nominatedâ€¦ I mostly agree with the european voters thing, but this movie actually was well-awarded in Venice Film Festival, which may give Torres some shots into that. LBNL, the Academy seems to be the first organization that gives this movie a shot, with the three nominations including BP (no one was predicting that).', 'PenÃ©lope Cruz didnâ€™t have quite the same support of the nominations, televisioned speech or even the interviews and outside campaigns that SPC is putting into Torres. My favorite shot right now to win is ofc Demi Moore or Mikey Madison (letâ€™s see SAG), but the race is not over. Itâ€™s far from it.', 'What is ofc?', 'Of course', 'No, lady. Sheâ€™s giving the Fernanda Torres â€œvibeâ€, unique, in a Brazilian film that is a masterpiece about a pivotal moment in our history. Fernanda Torres acting is superb, itâ€™s an acting lesson, indescribable. Your prejudice makes you blind to reality and makes you look really despicable by the way. Just watch Iâ€™m still here. You will see the difference.', 'Flawless ballot!', 'Hope that Rossellini winns
She is so ggod
Love Demi', 'North American or not, the voters with any film justice, would vote for Conclave â€“ Picture, Fernanda Torres â€“ Actress, Ralph Fiennes â€“ Actor, Isabella Rossellini -Supporting Actress, Guy Pierce- The Brutalist', 'Boring ass ballot. Grandpa vibes and a complete snoozefest. Thank god the ceremony will not go this way.', 'Well, Iâ€™m Brazilian and I think Demi will get it. But I wonâ€™t be surprised AT ALL if Fernanda wins.', 'Your email address will not be published. Required fields are marked *', 'Comment *', 'Name *', 'Email *', 'Website', '', '', '', 'Did the BAFTAs change the Oscar race? Will Demi Moore rebound at the Screen Actors Guild Awards? Awards Magnet hosts Christopher Rosen and Joyce Eng discuss the BAFTAs and make their SAG predictions with Gold Derby editor-in-chief Debra Birnbaum. Click the photo above to watch the video.', 'Watch our chats with Demi Moore (The Substance) and many more 2025 Oscar nomineesâ€¦', '', 'Take a trip back to the Academy Awards ceremonies of the recent past with Gold Derbyâ€™s Oscars Playback series. Hosts Joyce Eng and Christopher Rosen recap every Oscar ceremony of the 1990s and 2000s. Joyce and Chris tackle the highs and lows of each show and see how the winners aged. Itâ€™s a wonderful night for Oscar, whenever you watch!', 'GOLD DERBY IS A PART OF PENSKE MEDIA CORPORATION. Â© 2025 GOLD DERBY MEDIA, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
DEADLINE MEDIA']

Title: Secret Oscar Voter 4: Ballot exposed with â€˜The Brutalist,â€™ Sebastian Stan, Demi Moore
Paragraphs:
['Here in the final stages of the 2025 Oscar season, several Academy Awards voters have revealed their ballots to Gold Derby, telling us who they voted for â€” and why. We promised to keep their identities confidential and their comments unfiltered. Now that voting has concluded, we will share a few of the no-longer-secret ballots with you. Below are the selections of Voter 4. You can also read the summary of secret Oscar Voter 1, Oscar Voter 2, and Oscar Voter 3.', 'The Brutalist gave me some issues â€¦ but overall, it was this this real epic story that I think will be one that people return to. The part of it that I thought was so fascinating was the art and the artist. From a directorâ€™s standpoint, where you make art for others, itâ€™s really for you and having to kind of give it back or give up control. Conclave is one of those movies that will be enduring â€¦ and continues to inspire or catch your interest in different ways. Iâ€™m kind of a populist sometimes with Best Picture, and I know others who donâ€™t say that, so I think I would go Wicked near the top. Second place is Conclave. Third place is Wicked.', '', '', 'Ultimately what he was building towards that you find out in the end, I think he did an incredible job on a budget that was not massive. There were a lot of moving parts, and it felt really big.', 'Itâ€™s the vulnerability that I think it took to do some of the sequences that she did, especially the scene when sheâ€™s trying to get ready to go on a date. It was so heartbreaking, just not having the confidence and self kind of respect to get yourself out the door. She really went for it, even, a story that didnâ€™t completely work.', 'His acting was not like an impression, but he embodied this very complicated, real life person, which I think is a challenge. I think some others in the category, it was almost an imitation. This was the the one that spoke to me. I thought it was pretty transformative.', 'Can I say Jamie Lee Curtis? Letâ€™s be honest, Iâ€™m not in love with any of these, but I think I would say Zoe SaldaÃ±a because I think she does a lot,, but also does a little. She has beautiful choreographed numbers with singing, but sheâ€™s also kind of the the palm in the storm, and she handles all of it, I think, really in a very fantastical story. She is the thing that kind of brings it down to a a connecting force.', '', '', 'I thought that it was a perfect indie movie really, but such a well constructed film with these complex but knowable characters. And the different things that theyâ€™re struggling with and coming to grips with, and their relationships and you could just feel the pain of hearing Culkinâ€™s character, but also the joy, and I just thought he did that.', 'I think itâ€™s a brilliant adaptation. Itâ€™s a tough story to translate, and I think the way that they did it was not expected. Itâ€™s very well done.', 'Itâ€™s kind of understated but really provocative of everyoneâ€™s kind of journeys in their family out in the world, and just beautifully written.', 'SIGN UP for Gold Derbyâ€™s free newsletter with latest predictions', 'Brody will win, but Iâ€™m happy to see Stan pop up on one of these anonymous ballots. I think it is notable that even voters who arenâ€™t enamored with Emilia Perez and The Substance overall still seem to single out Moore and Saldana as elements they did like. Kieran is such a lock, they should just give him the Oscar right now and spare us any fake suspense regarding such an inevitable win. Interesting and bizarre how Nickel Boys got their vote for Adapted Screenplay, but Conclave was ranked above it for Picture.', 'Interesting to see how these different voters select their choices. Not interesting is that there arenâ€™t any choices that are far off the Oscar radar. Ultimately itâ€™s going to be Brody and Culkin, Saldana, and Moore. Sean Baker is taking the Director prize, Conclave is taking the top honor.', 'I donâ€™t know how you got to that conclusion from these ballots, when the lead actress category is clearly a three way race, and more people so far have said they voted for Torres than Moore. While the only industry award so far has been won by Mikey Madison.
And more people have so far said they have voted for Barbaro than for Saldana.
Or how â€œthere arenâ€™t any choices that are far off the Oscar radarâ€ when every single actor in the two male acting categories has gotten at least one vote, and Nickel Boys is currently tied with Conclave for Adapted Screenplay.', 'Demi Moore electrifying performance in Substance. Best Actress Demi Moore 2025', 'Someone commented that she was so overwhelmed by the volume of latex, fake blood, and barfed-up boobs, and so confused trying to puzzle through the storyâ€™s internal logic and parse its over-the-top third act, that she didnâ€™t really register Mooreâ€™s performance at all. The Substance is a mess, full of sound and fury, signifying little, with Moore given scant else to do besides â€œreact with horror to her latest mutation.â€
I agree with her 100%', 'The fact that she has the best â€œnarrativeâ€ of any Best Actress contender, winning the Oscar is ridiculous ğŸ™„ Oscars are irrelevant', 'I dont think This â€œsecret exposed votersâ€ really say much at all, except that Itâ€™s a competitive year, which we alreAdy knew. Culkin, Brody and Saldana Will Sweep, as expected. Culkin might not even show up to get his first oscar, but the guy deserves the throphy for â€˜ in my opiniÃ³nâ€™ the best performance of the yearâ€. With all due respect to â€œ double time holoucast survivor Adrian Brody.
The suspense remains for best leas Actress but i think Itâ€™s Demoi Moore. As for best picture, Unfortunatelly, I think Anora is not as Strong as people wants to think. Itâ€™s still my favorite movie of the year. I feel The brutalist will take the gold.', 'I agree with your pics but I think Mikey has a shot since she won the BAFTAS. Although, I really want Demi to win and Iâ€™m not even a horror fan. Great performance!', 'Also, Kieran should and will win. I saw A Real Pain when it premiered at Sundance and picked him for an Oscar back then.', 'The best movie of year is Im steel here, Conclave and The brutalist! And fernanda torres, ralph fienes, zoe saldana and kieran the best actors! My prefeer category is screenplay.. and Im steel here have a great script but not indicated like edward berger to director.. then brady corbet!! Conclave and the brutalist best screenplay.. but all adapted are very good!!', 'Your email address will not be published. Required fields are marked *', 'Comment *', 'Name *', 'Email *', 'Website', '', '', '', 'Did the BAFTAs change the Oscar race? Will Demi Moore rebound at the Screen Actors Guild Awards? Awards Magnet hosts Christopher Rosen and Joyce Eng discuss the BAFTAs and make their SAG predictions with Gold Derby editor-in-chief Debra Birnbaum. Click the photo above to watch the video.', 'Watch our chats with Demi Moore (The Substance) and many more 2025 Oscar nomineesâ€¦', '', 'Take a trip back to the Academy Awards ceremonies of the recent past with Gold Derbyâ€™s Oscars Playback series. Hosts Joyce Eng and Christopher Rosen recap every Oscar ceremony of the 1990s and 2000s. Joyce and Chris tackle the highs and lows of each show and see how the winners aged. Itâ€™s a wonderful night for Oscar, whenever you watch!', 'GOLD DERBY IS A PART OF PENSKE MEDIA CORPORATION. Â© 2025 GOLD DERBY MEDIA, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
DEADLINE MEDIA']

Title: The Oscars close the voting period and enter the final stretch of awards season
Paragraphs: ['', '', 'The winners will be announced at the gala on March 2', 'The members of the Hollywood Academy officially finished voting on Tuesday afternoon and the winners of the 97th Academy Awards will be announced on March 2 in Los Angeles, ending an uncertain season.', "The film industry's most prestigious awards will be held at the usual Dolby Theatre, located on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, marked by the fires that devastated the city of stars earlier this year and by the controversy surrounding 'Emilia Perez', the most nominated film, with 13 nominations.", "This season full of ups and downs is heading into the final stretch without a clear favorite: the Golden Globes recognized 'The Brutalist' as best drama film, by Brady Corbet, and comedy to 'Emilia Perez', by Jacques Audiard; the Critics Choice Awards chose the film 'Anora'' as the favorite, and recently the BAFTA crowned 'Conclave' as the best film. All titles are nominated for Oscars in the best picture category, along with 'I'm Still Here', by Walter Salles, or 'Wicked'.", "Voting for all these awards ended before the controversy erupted around Audiard's film when a series of racist, xenophobic and discriminatory posts made by its star, Spaniard Karla Sofia Gascon, resurfaced some time ago on the social network X.", 'Gascon, who is up for best actress alongside Demi Moore ("The Substance") and Fernanda Torres ("I\'m Still Here"), was removed from the promotional events for the Netflix film and the platform withdrew the support it usually provides to the cast of a nominated production in terms of flights, accommodation and clothing. It remains uncertain whether Gascon will attend the gala on her own.', "Behind 'Emilia Perez' are films such as 'Wicked' and 'The Brutalist', with 10 mentions each, while 'Conclave' and 'A Complete Unknown' are up for eight awards each. However, despite its six nominations, 'Anora' could win best film.", "The host of this year's gala will be comedian Conan O'Brien, and Spanish actress Penelope Cruz is expected to be one of the personalities to announce awards and participate in this film festival, along with Halle Berry, Scarlett Johansson and Emma Stone.", 'Â© Unidad Editorial InformaciÃ³n Deportiva, S.L.U. All rights reserved.', 'Follow us']

Title: Anonymous Oscar Ballot: Director Embraces â€˜Anora,â€™ â€˜A Complete Unknown,â€™ â€˜Sing Sing,â€™ and â€˜Wickedâ€™
Paragraphs: ['', 'With final Oscar balloting closed on February 18,  weâ€™re continuing with our seventh annual series of interviews with Academy voters from different branches for their unfiltered takes on what got picked, overlooked, and overvalued in the 2025 award season. Voterâ€™s picks are in bold. Interview edited for brevity.', 'Best Picture', 'â€œAnora.â€ I went with â€œA Complete Unknownâ€ for such a long time, for two months before I saw â€œAnora.â€ Just the balancing act of the humor, the tension, the male gaze sexiness, and [Anoraâ€™s] character being so aggressive and tough and not taking shit, this long-lost child inside. When that last scene happened, it broke your heart, and [Mikey Madison] was so good in it. And the boyfriend [Mark Eydelshteyn], from the moment he walked on the screen, I wanted to do violence to him. Every chance she gets, she would go in his lap and snuggle up and thereâ€™d be no conversation. He would be playing those games, and they did nothing but stimulate themselves. It says so much about people like that.', '', 'It looks like itâ€™s happening in front of you. And [Sean Baker]â€™s been doing that style from the beginning â€” that is hard to achieve. He directed it, but it doesnâ€™t feel like it was directed. It feels like he happened to be in the right place with the camera, and thatâ€™s a subtle difference. I look forward to more.', 'â€œA Complete Unknown,â€ I have zero distance. The second album I ever bought was â€œThe Times They Are A-changinâ€™.â€ I wore the grooves off it. And I got it for my 18th birthday. And then I went to a concert in Forest Hills two weeks after Newport, and saw the same thing. â€œWow, people, he did folk!â€ People liked it. Then he did rock, and everyone booed. So, I have no distance from it. I can watch it over and over again. Iâ€™ve seen it twice, okay? I know so much about Dylan. I donâ€™t mind all the moving around of the pieces of his life to make the story better. Having had experience doing musical biopics, you have to present the music so it carries the story forward. You donâ€™t stop the movie to watch someone sing. Then you end up with that Clint Eastwood movie [â€œJersey Boysâ€] about The Four Seasons and Frankie Valli. So the achievement of the director and the achievement of the movie was that the songs were a major character. And you felt them, and you listened to the words all over again, and TimothÃ©e Chalamet sang them with such care and feeling. So I love the movie.', '', 'â€œEmilia PÃ©rezâ€ is so daring. Itâ€™s preposterous to believe that this guy [Manitas] could change himself over and no one could figure it out. So I admire: â€œHow can I suspend reality enough to make everyone come along with me on this?â€ And [Jacques Audiard] did it by making it a musical. Because in a musical, reality is what you create. The movie was seamless. But discussions afterwards with friends have made me step back from from my enthusiasm for it in terms of how awful the drug trade is in Mexico, and how many people have died at the hands of it.', 'â€œThe Brutalistâ€ was like the concrete buildings. I couldnâ€™t. I just kept hitting the wall. Everything about it is excellent, but I couldnâ€™t get into it. I admired its artistry and the sheer effort: they made this one for [under $10 million].', 'â€œWicked,â€ I saw at the Academy, and it was thrilling, and I havenâ€™t thought about it again until this weekâ€™s WTF with Mark Maron and Ariana Grande. She is a thoughtful person. Coming away from â€œWicked,â€ I was dazzled by the production design, but Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande were just phenomenal. It was an achievement.', 'â€œThe Substanceâ€ did not go over very well at the Academy, but I loved it. There is so much Riot Girl punk energy in this movie. If weâ€™re looking for a connective theme this year, itâ€™s the emergence in mainstream of these kind of movies. And who knows what the mainstream is anymore, of female rage?', '', 'â€œNickel Boysâ€ is our hope for the future. That and [documentary feature] â€œSoundtrack for a Coup dâ€™Etatâ€ are both so brilliantly edited and put together in ways that are expressive. These movies present this information in a way thatâ€™s truly exciting and makes it work on several levels.', 'Best Director', 'â€œAnoraâ€ director Sean Baker. I did my homework this year. Iâ€™ve been going back and looking at everybodyâ€™s movies who I didnâ€™t know. I had seen â€œTangerineâ€ and â€œFlorida Project.â€ I went back and I watched â€œStarletâ€ on Criterion and â€œRed Rocket.â€ The really good filmmakers, you can see it from the beginning. Now I see the connective tissue. And how all these things he was interested in have come together in this film, the tension of it, and the humor and the slapstick for those henchmen, theyâ€™re hilarious and incredible. It is so hard to do.', 'â€œA Complete Unknownâ€ director James Mangold knows how to entertain. Heâ€™s a good director. I have never shown â€œFord v. Ferrariâ€ to anybody who didnâ€™t have a damn good time. He takes a complex subject that may not be for everybody. â€œA Complete Unknownâ€ was truly entertaining. And the weight of the movie ended up with Pete Seeger [Edward Norton]. And the director found the way to personify something that gave him conflict that we may not care that much about, which is traditional folk versus someone whoâ€™s changing the music forever. Thatâ€™s pretty arcane, but also moving.', '', 'Going back and seeing â€œDheepanâ€ and relooking at â€œRust and Boneâ€ and â€œThe Prophetâ€ and so forth, Jacques Audiard, the director of â€œEmelia PÃ©rez,â€ is a world-class director.', 'I look to the future for the director of â€œThe Substance,â€ [Coralie Fargeat].', 'Best Actress', 'â€œIâ€™m Still Hereâ€ is another family saga: itâ€™s the strength of the mother. I voted for that performance, Fernanda Torres. Iâ€™m all for Demi Moore giving us her â€œMy name is Mrs. Norman Maineâ€ speech. We need that on the Oscars, and I hope she wins. But [Fernanda Torres] was the thread that carried you along in â€œIâ€™m Still Here.â€', 'Best Actor', 'Adrien Brody shoulders [â€œThe Brutalistâ€]. Heâ€™s in every frame of it, and he makes a truly unpleasant, artistic man understandable. Heâ€™s driven and cannot be pushed down. I would hate to have dinner with him and Bob Dylan at the same time, there could not be two more unpleasant people, plus the amount of smoking would drive you crazy.', 'So the non-smoking performance of the year was Colman Domingo in â€œSing Sing.â€ He should be the MVP every year. Heâ€™s in the batting order: â€œOh, okay, heâ€™s up at the plate.â€ Iâ€™m going with Domingo over TimothÃ©e Chalamet.', 'Best Supporting Actress', 'Zoe SaldaÃ±a was: â€œI know youâ€™ve been here all these years.â€ Well, finally, weâ€™re noticing it was the performance of the year. She carried â€œEmilia PÃ©rez.â€', '', 'Felicity Jones in a tough situation [arriving in the second half], made an impression [in â€œThe Brutalistâ€]. After listening to Ariana Grande on Mark Maron and all the SNL stuff, I thought, â€œWeâ€™re going to see her again. Sheâ€™s just a super talent.â€', 'Best Supporting Actor', '[Edward Norton]. One of the best parts of [â€œA Complete Unknownâ€] was the anchoring of Pete Seeger. This crucial change that [Mangold] made is the scene where Dylan sings â€œThe Song for Woody,â€ for Woody Guthrie and [Seeger] at the beginning, which is not when it happened, but it may as well have been. The look on those two menâ€™s faces: â€œwe are witnessing somebody being born.â€ Itâ€™s like in â€œAmadeusâ€ when Salieri invites [Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart] to lunch and plays this piece of music, and then Amadeus plays it upside down and backwards after hearing it once: â€œOkay, this is the real deal.â€', 'Best Adapted Screenplay', 'I voted for â€œSing Sing.â€ [Greg Kwedar and Clint Bentley] told the story really well.', 'Best Original Screenplay', 'I voted for, oddly enough, the movie that should have been nominated for editing: â€œSeptember 5.â€ The screenplay put together these real events and and juggled them around with what footage they had.', 'Best Cinematography', 'We are now in an age of special effects and cinematography being difficult to judge. The standards are so high, the ability of these artists to pull this stuff off. When you look at cinematography, Ed Lachman is such a serious artist. On â€œMaria,â€ he doesnâ€™t just shoot a movie. He builds cameras to capture something.', '', 'In â€œEmilia PÃ©rez,â€ the cinematography was so fluid, and the camera movements that go between the director and the DP carry you across those intense transitions to music. You can light scenes [with] LEDs, and you can change the color temperature of each light: they did that. Color temperature is now off the scale in terms of quality for everything we see.', 'I didnâ€™t make it all the way through â€œNosferatu.â€ Iâ€™ve seen this movie, having seen the silent versions and so forth. You know them all. It doesnâ€™t mean the cinematography and the production design werenâ€™t thrilling.', 'Best Costume Design', 'The â€œWickedâ€ costumes are gorgeous. Beyond that, if weâ€™re talking about how to make a movie, the management skills on that movie, the size of that cast â€” I have made a few musicals, and I know what happens to costumes between takes, everyone gets sweated up, and you gotta change everything.', 'Best Documentary Feature', 'The documentary features are also worthy. â€œBlack Box Diaries,â€ wow. But then I saw the chances creatively that they took with the story of Patrice Lumumba in [â€œSoundtrack for a Coup dâ€™Etatâ€] and seeing those jazz artists and understanding how insidious contemporary colonialism is. But the disjunctive editing style threw [some people] off: they couldnâ€™t follow it. In all this voting Iâ€™m voicing: â€œwe should try new things.â€', '', 'Best Editing', 'For the sheer effort, â€œWicked.â€', 'â€œAnoraâ€ is a great study in character editing, helping those mood swings. The humor is how you cut the scenes. Itâ€™s there. Can you dig it out and yet still not lose the tension? [Mikey Madison] carries â€œAnoraâ€ without ruining the movie.', 'Best International Feature Film', 'So the international pictures, once again, theyâ€™re the best in show. They are the strength of world cinema. I said, â€œ[â€˜Emilia PÃ©rezâ€™] is the one.â€ But then I saw â€œThe Seed of the Sacred Fig.â€ When you think about making that movie in secret, about the commitment, and you live with what those people are going throughâ€¦ that knocked me out. â€œFlowâ€ is amazing. I was thrilled.', 'Best Makeup and Hairstyling', 'â€œThe Substance,â€ because everyone comes out of the theater grossed out. Thatâ€™s hard to do these days.', 'Best Production Design', 'I went with â€œWicked,â€ because I saw in the bake-off the building of the train. So much detail, so much effort, so beautiful. The production design was suitably gaudy. The best thing about â€œGladiator IIâ€ was Arthur Maxâ€™s production design.', 'Best Original Score', 'â€œThe Brutalistâ€', 'Best Original Song', 'â€œEl Malâ€ (â€œEmilia PÃ©rezâ€)', 'Best Sound', 'They all work. They all are beautifully mixed. But â€œA Complete Unknownâ€ beautifully integrated the songs. The art of making a musical bio is how you layer in the songs and the drama, and you canâ€™t let the drama stop when the song finishes. That is the gift. The music editing was superb. We know and love these songs and through editing they were seamlessly integrated. Especially the non-Dylan songs for context. Nothing is more fun in the editing room than a needle drop that works!', '', 'Best Visual Effects', 'This was tough, because â€œKingdom of the Planet of The Apesâ€ is so convincing, and the eight performances are terrific. And â€œAlien: Romulusâ€ is as good as those alien movies can get. But Iâ€™ve never seen anything like â€œWicked,â€ so I went with that.', 'Best Documentary Short', 'The world is in such terrible shape right now, I could not bear to watch five more shorts about how terrible it is.', 'Best Live Action Short', 'It was really tough between â€œA Lienâ€ and â€œThe Last Ranger.â€ The problem with some of these things is youâ€™re voting for the cause. I ended up voting for â€œThe Last Ranger.â€', 'Best Animated Feature, Shorts.', 'I didnâ€™t watch them.', 'By providing your information, you agree to our Terms of Use and our Privacy Policy. We use vendors that may also process your information to help provide our services. This site is protected by reCAPTCHA Enterprise and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.', 'By providing your information, you agree to our Terms of Use and our Privacy Policy. We use vendors that may also process your information to help provide our services. This site is protected by reCAPTCHA Enterprise and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.']

Title: Secret Oscar Voter 2: Ballot exposed with â€˜Anora,â€™ Demi Moore, TimothÃ©e Chalamet
Paragraphs: ['Here in the final stages of the 2025 Oscar season, several Academy Awards voters have revealed their ballots to Gold Derby, telling us who they voted for â€” and why. We promised to keep their identities confidential and their comments unfiltered. Now that voting has concluded, we will share a few of the no-longer-secret ballots with you. Below are the selections of Voter 1. You can also read the summary of secret Oscar Voter 1.', 'This is a more likable and approachable film than several of the choices. I really like Sean Bakerâ€˜s work, so Iâ€™m glad to see that heâ€™s getting this recognition in both categories now. And then The Brutalist is a film that has a lot of power about the strength of the human spirit. The world that it took us through was also fascinating in the time period. Second place is The Brutalist. Third place is A Complete Unknown.', '', '', 'Another tough category, but one of the things that struck me about it was the craftsmanship. Sean really deserves the recognition for consistently delivering emotional connections in an understated fashion.', 'I know this is an interesting category now, and I was torn between Demi Moore and Mikey Madison. For Mikey, it was a real breakout performance, but I think I just have to be content that she has to be happy with the nomination. Demi has been one of the most visible actresses in the industry for many years with many important films. I think the role was very courageous because itâ€™s saying, look, Iâ€™ve been part of this establishment and this movie is really tearing it apart and she goes all in on it and totally makes it work. I really feel comfortable, and, of course, she did make that great speech at the Golden Globes, too.', 'I think a lot of people were surprised by this film as I was that I first didnâ€™t seem that interested in it. And then when I saw it I was blown away and was just totally drawn into the film completely. I have to attribute that to the acting, to TimothÃ©e Chalametâ€˜s performance. The world that they brought to life just felt very authentic to me.', 'I think she totally almost carried the film with her singing and the dancing, and her engagement was just so strong. Oh, sheâ€™s amazing. And then of course the other dramatic and and other other stuff that she does thatâ€™s in a movie that is very unconventional. I think she helped anchor it. My second choice there was Felicity Jones.', '', '', 'Culkin just takes a very difficult role and, and I think totally pulls the audience into it in terms of his roller coaster emotional ride. It shows the complexity of the character in a really good way. My second choice there was Jeremy Strong for The Apprentice because I think he totally played a monster. A lot of these categories are really hard this year.', 'I think that they were very courageous in translating that to the screen and should be recognized for that. Itâ€™s a really exceptional film, and Iâ€™d love to see it get some recognition at the Oscars for the creative chances they took with it.', 'Thatâ€™s kind of a no-brainer. From the first frame, itâ€™s so, so astounding and the epic story and the amount of time that he covers in the film is pretty amazing. Yet itâ€™s still very, very, very powerful over the course of the film. It really sticks to you.', 'SIGN UP for Gold Derbyâ€™s free newsletter with latest predictions', 'â€œ I think she totally almost carried the film with her singing and the dancing, and her engagement was just so strong.â€ Seriously, did this voter watch Wicked? I canâ€™t believe so, for them to determine Zoeâ€™s sing-talking was superior to Arianaâ€™s musically comedic masterclass. I respect the recognition for Demi.', 'As Iâ€™ve been saying, the race is â€œI didnâ€™t know Zoe could sing & danceâ€ vs. â€œI didnâ€™t know Ariana could actâ€. Both are misconceptions, but Iâ€™d say Zoeâ€™s job was harder â€” especially since it was mostly in Spanish.', 'Zoeâ€™s job wasnâ€™t necessarily more difficult. Especially considering the high notes Ariana had to hit while singing live. And Ariana still outperformed her â€“ putting aside the difficulties of the jobs, Arianaâ€™s performance was undoubtedly more compelling.', 'Zoeâ€™s singing and talking in Spanish shouldnâ€™t be considered so difficult, especially because sheâ€™s saying sheâ€™s latina and speaks Spanish and even forgot how to speak English', 'Have you ever seen Kristen Chenowithâ€™s version of Glinda? While Ariana Grande delivered an exceptional performance she was 100% copying Kristen Chenowithâ€™s original Glinda. So if anyone delivered a â€œmasterclassâ€ and is truly deserving of the Oscar itâ€™s Kristen Chenowith, not Ariana Grande.', 'Yes Nickel Boys! Demi!\nOne semi sane voice in an ocean of weirdness.', 'Demi Moore es la mejor actriz. Actualmente incontestable', 'ActuaciÃ³n incontestable, de otro nivel, por eso Demi Moore merece el Oscar.', 'Not sure why many voters and critics think The Brutalist is such a great film. It has its moments especially when Guy Pierce is on screen. I have to say Adrian Brody was good, but Ralph Fiennes and Timothy Chalamet are better. As for The Brutalist for Screenplay, this Oscar voter didnâ€™t see the second half after the intermission. Thatâ€™s when it fell apart and seemed, like it was looking for a way to end. Anora had a better original screenplay.', 'Voting for Demi for narrative rather than best performance is wrong.', 'She is by no means a great actress â€“ not even above-average. Just because she has a compelling â€˜narrativeâ€™ does not mean she is worthy of an Oscar. The nomination itself is a win.', 'I think Demi was great in The Substance and is deserving purely on that basis. But â€œsheâ€™s been in many important filmsâ€? Please. She was the worst part of the most important film sheâ€™s been in (A Few Good Men) and the rest have been good popcorn (Ghost, St. Elmos Fire) or middling-bad popcorn (the rest). GI Jane could have been 100 times more powerful with a stronger actress.', 'Your email address will not be published. Required fields are marked *', 'Comment *', 'Name *', 'Email *', 'Website', '', '', '', 'Did the BAFTAs change the Oscar race? Will Demi Moore rebound at the Screen Actors Guild Awards? Awards Magnet hosts Christopher Rosen and Joyce Eng discuss the BAFTAs and make their SAG predictions with Gold Derby editor-in-chief Debra Birnbaum. Click the photo above to watch the video.', 'Watch our chats with Demi Moore (The Substance) and many more 2025 Oscar nomineesâ€¦', '', 'Take a trip back to the Academy Awards ceremonies of the recent past with Gold Derbyâ€™s Oscars Playback series. Hosts Joyce Eng and Christopher Rosen recap every Oscar ceremony of the 1990s and 2000s. Joyce and Chris tackle the highs and lows of each show and see how the winners aged. Itâ€™s a wonderful night for Oscar, whenever you watch!', 'GOLD DERBY IS A PART OF PENSKE MEDIA CORPORATION. Â© 2025 GOLD DERBY MEDIA, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.\nDEADLINE MEDIA']

Title: Secret Oscar Voter 1: Ballot exposed with â€˜Emilia PÃ©rez,â€™ Mikey Madison, Colman Domingo
Paragraphs: ['', '', '', '', '', 'Here in the final stages of the 2025 Oscar season, several Academy Awards voters have revealed their ballots to Gold Derby, telling us who they voted for â€” and why. We promised to keep their identities confidential and their comments unfiltered. Now that voting has concluded, we will share a few of the no-longer-secret ballots with you. Below are the selections of Voter 1.', 'Let me start out here by acknowledging that I totally understand why some people will steer clear of supporting Emilia PÃ©rez because of the offensive social media posts of its star from several years ago. But let me also add the obvious: it has nothing to do with the quality of the film, which to my mind is greater than its nine fellow nominees. You simply cannot watch this movie and not be bowled over by its cleverness and how distinctive and powerfully quirky it is. If the Academy Awards are about honoring originality â€” and to my mind, they should be â€” you canâ€™t get much more original than this. Thereâ€™s never been a movie even remotely like it before. Second place is Anora. Third place is Conclave.', 'More from GoldDerby', 'Who should play the next James Bond (and who could direct)?', "Secret Oscar Voter 4: Ballot exposed with 'The Brutalist,' Sebastian Stan, Demi Moore", 'When are the SAG Awards?
